parameters.description: Scalar values needed for the rostering problem

horizon.title: Horizon
horizon.description: The number of weeks that are going to be solved

slot_length.title: Slot length
slot_length.description: The length of each time slot in minutes

starting_date.title: Starting date
starting_date.description: The first day that has to be solved

min_working_hours.title: Minimum hours work per day
min_working_hours.description: The minimum amount of hours that have to be worked each day that the employee works

min_resting_hours.title: Minimum hours to rest
min_resting_hours.description: The minimum amount of hours that have to be rested between the end of the shift on one day, and the start of the shift on the next day

requirements.description: Boolean values to activate or deactivate different requirements of the problem

rq09.title: Skills
rq09.description: The demand of skills has to be covered

rq11.title: Store holidays
rq11.description: The days when a store is closed are respected

rq13.title: Employee starting hour preference
rq13.description: The employee starting hour is respected

rq14.title: Employee max hours worked
rq14.description: The employee maximum hours worked preference is respected

employees.description: Table with the employee master information

id.description: The unique identifier for each employee.
id.title: Employee id.

manager.description: If the employee is a manager or not.
manager.title: Manager

manager_tasks.description: If the employee can perform the tasks of a manager without being one. It is not required.
manager_tasks.title: Manager tasks

shifts.description: Table with the shifts master information

id.description: The unique identifier of each shift.
id.title: Shift id.

start.description: The earliest hour that an employee assigned to this shift can start working.
start.title: Starting hour

end.description: The latest hour that an employee assigned to this shift can stop working.
end.title: Ending hour

contracts.description: Table with the relationship between employees, shifts and their past, current and future contracts

id.description: The unique identifier of each contract.
id.title: Contract id.

id_employee.description: The unique identifier of the employee assigned to the contract.
id_employee.title: Employee id.

id_shift.description: The unique identifier of the shift assigned to the contract.
id_shift.title: Shift id.

start_contract.description: The starting date of the contract. Must be a Monday and have format YYYY-MM-DD.
start_contract.title: Contract start

end_contract.description: The ending date of the contract. Must be a Sunday and have format YYYY-MM-DD. It is not required and can be void.
end_contract.title: Contract end

weekly_hours.description: The number of hours that the employee has to work each week.
weekly_hours.title: Contract weekly hours

days_worked.description: The number of days that the employee has to work per week.
days_worked.title: Contract weekly days

demand.description: Demand that needs to be covered and tried to make the same across all time slots

day.description: The date of the demand. Has to have format YYYY-MM-DD.
day.title: Day

weekly_schedule.description: Opening and closing times of every day of the week

week_day.description: Day of the week in number. 1 is Monday
week_day.title: Day of week

starting_hour.description: The hour the work center opens
starting_hour.title: Opening hour

ending_hour.description: The hour the work center closes
ending_hour.title: Closing hour

schedule_exceptions.description: Schedule exceptions that override weekly schedule

starting_hour.description: The hour the work center opens
starting_hour.title: Opening hour

ending_hour.description: The hour the work center closes
ending_hour.title: Closing hour
